news_header: The Helsinki Stock Exchange saw a rise on Monday, with Nokia announcing a new CEO. Investors House reported improved performance, while Oma Savings Bank faced investigations. Metso is expanding its business in China, and BBS-Bioactive is seeking additional funding.
news_text: On Monday afternoon, the Helsinki Stock Exchange rose, with the OMXH general index up by 0.4%. Nokia's online equipment company increased by 2.1% as it announced Pekka Lundmark's departure as Managing Director, with Justin Hotard appointed as the new CEO. Investors House reported a performance improvement and increased its dividend, while Oma Savings Bank faced investigations over credit losses. Metso is investing in its screening business in China, and BBS-Bioactive Bone Substitutes is negotiating additional funding. Wetteri Auto acquired Hed's Automotive business, and several companies adjusted their target prices.
